episodes.title: ECKANKAR: THE PATH OF SPIRITUAL CONTROL
episodes.description:
#eckankar
#cults
#religiouscults

In this livestream, we’re diving into the mysterious world of Eckankar—a lesser-known but still active cult founded by Paul Twitchell in the 1960s. Before starting Eckankar, Twitchell worked his way up in Scientology and even achieved the level of "Clear." But instead of sticking with L. Ron Hubbard's teachings, he borrowed heavily from them—along with ideas from Theosophy, Radhasoami, and other traditions—to create his own spiritual movement.

We’ll explore Twitchell’s early life, the lies he told about his background, and how scholar David C. Lane exposed its plagiarized roots. Lane’s groundbreaking research revealed just how much of Eckankar was copied from other sources—and how Twitchell manipulated his image to appear as a divine messenger.

If you’ve never heard of Eckankar, you’re not alone—but it’s time we start talking about it again. This is a great introduction to this religious cult. 

For my other coverage of the Eckankar cult, see these videos/streams:

episodes.title: MLM Cult Forever Living Wants YOU to Pay to Work for Them
episodes.description:
#foreverliving  
#mlmexposed  
#antimlm 

Forever Living, one of the most well-known MLMs in the world, is now charging its distributors a $3 monthly fee just to access their back office and run their so-called "business." In this video, I break down what this fee means, why it's problematic, and how it's yet another example of MLM companies profiting off their own members rather than actual product sales.

This is a classic move used by multi-level marketing schemes to squeeze money from their downlines under the guise of "business tools." But is it ethical? Is it even legal? And how does it reflect on the overall MLM business model?

Let’s talk about it.

👉 Don’t forget to like, comment, and subscribe for more deep dives on scams, cults, and MLM exploitation.
